New Records: Harry Brook scored 53 runs off 37 balls, his first World Cup fifty.
Anrich Nortje took a crucial catch to win the match.
South Africa remain unbeaten at 6-6 in the World Cup.
Key Match Events: The match was decided in the last over by Anrich Nortje's bowling and Aiden Markram's catch.
Harry Brook's fifty and England's chase were significant moments.
England's spinners and South Africa's pace bowlers played crucial roles.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa relied on their pace bowlers, while England's spinners performed well.
England needed to improve their net run rate for future matches.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's coach highlighted the team's resilience.
England's future matches and net run rate were discussed.
The win was pivotal for South Africa's tournament progression.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in St Lucia with windy conditions.
Notable fielding catches and individual performances were mentioned.
